result.execSummary:
The defendant Janeska Renkas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To be paid in full within first four (4) months of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No entry into any taverns or bars, except for employment purposes only.
Authorized expunction only upon successful completion of probation, including following all conditons.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Janeska Renkas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Janeska Renkas in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:03 PM. State - Here for FPT. Lynch hands court PLQ -  and recites agreement, amend only count to disorderly conduct under 947.01. Defendant will be placed on probation for 12 months, conditions of probation restitution in the amount $732.30 includes surcharge, to be paid within the first 4 months of probation. Lynch requests the probation condition of no entry into bar or tavern, asks that she be allowed to enter for employment purposes only, state does not object.  State - has complied with victim notification. Court reviews victim impact statements. Renkas understands agreement. Court amends count one to disorderly conduct under 947.01, reads the new charge and penalties. Renkas pleads NC to amended charge. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds she is entering her plea freely and voluntarily, waived constitutional rights, finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State make final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final statement and asks to follow joint recommendation. Renkas makes statement, remorseful. Court adopts joint recommendation and sentences defendant to the following: Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions of restitiution $732.30 (includes VW surcharge) to be paid within 4 months of probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into bars/taverns except for employment purposes only, AODA and follow through, FT employment or schooling, 50 hours of community service, authorizes expungement upon completion of probation, including following all conditions of probation, DNA sample with surcharge (advises of DNA expunction under 973.015), costs. Adjourned, 2:21 PM

Defendant Janeska Renkas in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:01 AM. Renkas has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Renkas understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford her own. Court provides defendant with court appointed paperwork and instructed to contact SPD. Recess to talk to SPD at 10:02 AM. Recalled at 10:42 AM. Defendant now appears with Chad Lynch barring any conflicts, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. State - bond - $200.00 cash. Lynch - requests signature bond. Court - bond - $500.00 signature bond and refund bond money to poster. Court accepts pleas, sets for FPT on 3/24/16 at 2:00 PM.
